channel.title: Party Roll - A 5E Dungeons and Dragons Podcast
channel.itunes:summary: We're six friends who shoved microphones in front our faces while playing dungeons and dragons. Listen along while we drink, tell jokes, and make the DM hate us! New episodes every Friday.

image.title: Party Roll - A 5E Dungeons and Dragons Podcast

channel.itunes:author: Party Roll Podcast
channel.description: We're seven friends who shoved microphones in front our faces while playing dungeons and dragons. Listen along while we drink, tell jokes, and make the DM hate us! Updates come every other Friday.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Who gave us mics?

item.title: Savage Roll - S2E6 - Flight
item.itunes:title: Flight
item.description:
Join us on a special side-campaign in the Savage Worlds RPG system! We will sometimes record and release other game systems outside of our normal DnD release schedule. There's no set schedule for these episodes, they'll come when they come. Feel free to skip these if you're not interested!

The party gets some loot and continues their investigations...

Thanks for listening!

Playing Savage Worlds - Custom Steven Campaign

partyrollpodcast.com | @party_roll | facebook.com/partyrollpodcast | patreon | teener time

item.title: Savage Roll - E10 - End
item.description:
Join us on a special side-campaign in the Savage Worlds RPG system! We will sometimes record and release other game systems outside of our normal DnD release schedule. There's no set schedule for these episodes, they'll come when they come. Feel free to skip these if you're not interested!

In this episode, the party works together to bring this campaign to a close in a thrilling battle!

Thanks for listening, it's been a fun season!

item.title: Party Roll - S2E10 - Nightbrawlers
item.description:
The party makes the best use of their night in town before heading to the mainland.

Party Roll Recipes:

A Whiskey Thick - Mix 1 part whiskey with 2 parts whipped cream. Pour over ice.

Country Cream Pie - Eat 1 entire cream pie of your choice. Start chuggin a cheap whiskey of your choice. You'll know when to stop.

Shredded Gin and Tonic - Make a gin and tonic. Garnish with shredded cheddar cheese.

Tequlia Funrise - Aztec brand tequila poured over french onion cream cheese. Served in a cold corn tortilla.

Breakfast of Champions - Leave a can of Coors Light and some heavy cream out over night. Mix them together 1:1. Chug.

Non Dairy Steamer - Warm up a tall cup of Vodka in a microwave. Add powdered coffee creamer to taste.

Gin and toxic - Run room temperature gin through used coffee grounds and filter. Garnish with splenda.

Bud Rice - Bring Bud Ice malt liquor to boil, add rice, simmer for 10 minutes. Don't drain. 

Egg White Russian - Make a white Russian with Egg Whites instead of milk.

A Barfirita - Make a margarita, add two shots of Bailey's serve in one of those stone salsa bowl things, top with cottage cheese and Crest Oral B Enamel Health Toothpaste.

The Te-killa - Tequila and scotch, shaken and poured into a glass filled with chilled old pennies

Pepperpeach - Water from the bottom of that slightly clogged urinal every bathroom has, add a shot or two of off-brand peach schnapps, pour into pig-shaped salt shaker, gently lay a single layer of fresh toilet paper on the surface, finish by sprinkling a bit of pepper from the salt shakers twin

Ex-wrestler - Mix equal parts Fireball Whiskey and lemon juice. Pour into discarded malt liquor bottle with 2 egg whites and shake vigorously. Rim bottle mouth with paprika.

Tackling Fuel - Drink Natty Light until you think it's normal to try and wrestle with everyone. Then get mad when people act like you are weird.

*Actual Recipe* Black Mob - 1:1 tequila & baileys, squeeze in lime slice, puke on kitchen floor and fall asleep on toilet.

Russian Flapjack - Make pancake mix with vodka instead of water. Layer the batter with syrup and molasses. Best served warm as a shot.

Gintle Kiss Goodnight - Drink an entire bottle of Gin in one sitting. Kiss someone upside the head with the empty bottle.

Whistlin' Dixie - Chug a full tall boy of your choice through the gap where your incisors used to be.

Whiskey Sandwich - Soak bread, ham, turkey, cheese and chips in whiskey over night. Put the mush together on a plate and consume. Add mustard and mayo to taste.

Raw Dawg - 40oz of Red Dawg malt liquor poured over a 12 oz bowl of uncooked beef cubes. Serves up to three.

Morning After - Attempt to use a warm bottle of whiskey as a contraceptive. Drink what comes out as you don't want to be wasteful.

Hair of the Dog - Scrape the leftover bloody mary from the sides of your blender you left out all night, don't pick out the hair from your pets that have been licking the top of the blender for several hours. Fry this up into a hardened cake while toasting bread till black. Put your haircake on the toast and eat. Toast must be burnt for maximum carbon benefit.

The Health Nut - Put yogurt and granola in a mason jar to eat after your drive to work. Slam on your brakes after nearly getting into a car accident so it rolls under your seat and you forget about it. Consume after several weeks of brewing into a fermented penicillin like substance.

 

Hope these help! Thanks for listening.

Playing DnD 5E - Custom Mark Campaign

item.description:
Maelstrom in a chamber pot. Spiders are mean! The group makes a mistake on remembering who they fed a skulltato chip to. A certain flamable bone returns. We learn of The Black Spider's namesake! Thanks for listening! You're our favorite.

A certain skull has a bad time in the party's possession. Grick makes a convincing argument, but feels guilty about it. The group Forges ahead and meets a charming being. Whiz Ard confirms that he is a wizard several times. Seth totally tells the truth.
What lies ahead for our adventurers? Listen in and find out!

item.title: Party Roll - 18 - Collective Bugbeargaining Rights
item.description:
Dusty makes a party-sneeze. Mark talks to himself. Negotiations are made with The Black Spider. The party gives valuable workplace advice. Things get 2spooky again. Matt has no concept of time. Some dirty bugbears get names! No one knows how to pronounce Shibe. Or Doge. Whiz Ard is actually less useful in combat for once (and only once)! Seth is sniper extraordinaire. Everyone can't stop using each other's last names. Join us as our adventure continues!
Thanks for listening. You're a really good listener. Has anyone ever said that about you?

Seth is sniper extraordinaire. Everyone can't stop using each other's last names. Join us as our adventure continues! Thanks for listening. You're a really good listener. Has anyone ever said that about you? Playing DnD 5E -- Lost Mine of Phandelver partyrollpodcast.com | @party_roll | facebook.com/partyrollpodcast

item.title: Party Roll - 17 - Cave Improvement
item.description:
Engineer Rory brings a midi-keyboard with sound effects tied to the keys. Matt and Steven goad DJ Dusty into triggering the FX many times, making Mark madder than ever! Enjoy it while it lasts, because we put the keyboard away for the rest of the campaign. It was too powerful.
The party comes to the end of their traveling journey as they descend into Wave Echo Cave. A dwarf cries. Dusty gives a very touching soliloquy. Things get 2spooky. Seth is always super duper prepared. Things get slimey! Matt makes his 100th Dark Souls reference. The DM reveals saddening facts about Tekno Viking ;-; . Seth stealths. Eventually, the party finds itself meeting a powerful foe...
Thanks for listening! You're our favorite.

Playing DnD 5E -- Lost Mine of Phandelver

item.title: Party Roll - 16 - Chef Rogue-an
item.description:
Everyone basks in the glow of their previous victory while Mark, Cory, and Steven educate us on OwlBear behavior rituals. Whiz finds some scrolls of the aged variety. The party meets an old friend! Seth gives into his culinary urges. Delicious food for everyone! Everyone is enamored with Steven's fancy shirt. Finally, the party sets off towards what would appear to be the final dungeon.
Thanks for listening. You are wonderful.

Playing DnD 5E -- Lost Mine of Phandelver
Go to our webzone if you want the intro song for yourself!

item.title: Party Roll - 0 - Bonus Backstory Bonanza
item.description:
Listen in as Mark, Cory, Matt, and Steven fill in the gaps of the story thus far. They reflect on the campaign that happened Before the Mic, as well as chat about their previous campaigns and histories.

So grab a chair, throw it into the fire, and sit on the ground as you listen to this bonus story episode.

Thanks!

item.title: Party Roll - 15 - Wrassle in the Castle
item.description:
SHOWDOWN WITH KING DAVE GROHL
We continue to learn how to play D&D, yay for learning! We give a small sad shoutout to PathGuy. Seth's hat lust grows to TF2 levels, but takes a beating. Whiz Ard proves that he's THE BEST THE BEST THE BEST and could solo this entire campaign. A scary creature appears! Grick and Seth tag team a Drow. Tekno Viking gives a Spin Punch Final Goodbye.
Thanks for listening! Your ears are comfy.

Playing DnD 5E -- Lost Mine of Phandelver

item.title: Party Roll - 14 - Peanut Butter Jovlyns
item.description:
TKV calls upon his Ki! Seth runs out of things to do. :C Grick becomes a true gentlesir. Cory becomes confused by a nickname. Whimsical continues to prove to be the most useful of the party members. TKV calls upon his Ki again for a little slap and tickle! Seth and the group grapple for loot. Whiz pokes and jokes. Grick hates doors.
Thanks for listening. You make me have... feelings.....

item.title: Party Roll - 13 - ⚡GRICK VS GRICK⚡
item.description:
HHHGGYYYEEAAHHHH BROTHER. WE GOT SOME GRICK ON GRICK ACTION COMIN AT YOU.
Mark makes some clarifications. The group comes across a trap! Nobody knows how to say "brazier". A formidable enemy appears. More mysteries are uncovered about Whiz Ard. Grick and Grick grick some gricks. Should we abandon our podcast for a lucrative singing career? Professor Cory gives us a very informative history lesson.
Thanks for listening. You are wonderful.

We got a new website! Check us out at partyrollpodcast.com
